result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin Edward Prude

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Kevin Edward Prude.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is in compliance with the deferred prosecution agreement. Defendant needs to attend all office contacts in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 10.17.2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Edward Prude appeared by video means.
Defendant attended all office contacts and completed 10 hours of community service. Defendant is working on enrollment for treatment. Case adjourned to Branch 21.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 400 of the Courthouse.  Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 7.12.2022
received and filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Wiaver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended.  Case is adjourned for review hearing in Br 21  mn  Review hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Postconviction Relief, Filed
Voting Restrictions, Filed.
JT Waiver, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver - Filed.
DPA, Filed.

Recall issued.

signed and filed.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancels the bench warrant. Court vacates the calendar call on 3/29/22. Defense requests a DPA hearing. Any change of plea forms and DPA paperwork should be filed by 4/12/22. Case is adjourned to Br. 17.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
signed and filed.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Ashley Fard in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued, REMAND TO JUDGE. Court withholds decision as to bail. Court sets matter for a calendar call in Branch 17.  Calendar call scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Edward Prude appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Ashley Pashewitz, Officer Milwaukee Police Department.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in Court with Attorney Ashley Fard.  Jon R Josephsen on behalf of John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Indigency hearing. Parties appeared in Room 316 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Attorney Fard was recently appointed by the Public Defender's Office. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am. Parties can appear In-Person in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility -OR- via Zoom Video Conference.
received and filed.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant appears without counsel.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Kevin Edward Prude in court with attorney Ashley Fard.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 1/25/22 @ 1:30p
